DataElement.preferredName: Patient Measurable Or Evaluable Disease Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded indicator as to whether the patient meets the eligibility requirements for participation in a clinical trial with regards to measurable or evaluable disease.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Measurable Disease Or Evaluable Disease Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._A finding indicating that a subject has one or more measurable pathological lesions._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._Disease that cannot be measured directly by the size of the tumor but can be evaluated by other methods specific to a particular clinical trial._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Measurable Disease Or Evaluable Disease Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: A tumor that can be accurately measured in size. This information can be used to judge response to treatment.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:Disease that cannot be measured directly by the size of the tumor but can be evaluated by other methods specific to a particular clinical trial.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: A finding indicating that a subject has one or more measurable pathological lesions.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
Disease that cannot be measured directly by the size of the tumor but can be evaluated by other methods specific to a particular clinical trial.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: For the dose expansion cohort
ReferenceDocuments.description: For the dose expansion cohort: Does patient with neuroblastoma have measurable disease by RECIST v1.1 (question 5) or MIBG-evaluable disease at enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Dose escalation/phase I:  Does patient have metastatic or recurrent solid tumors with measurable or evaluable disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: For Cohort B2, does patient have evaluable NBL (MIBG and/or bone marrow disease only)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: For the dose expansion cohort: Does patient with neuroblastoma have measurable disease by RECIST v1.1 or MIBG-evaluable disease at enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is in Part 1, does patient have evaluable or measurable disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is in the dose expansion phase (PD cohort): Does patient have disease that is evaluable or measurable by Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) version 1.1?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Dose Escalation Cohort Only:  Does patient have evaluable disease or measurable disease per RECIST 1.1 criteria?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have measurable disease or evaluable disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have radiographically measurable or evaluable disease (as per RECISTv1.1)?
